{"step_by_step_thinking": "Neuroblastoma is a cancer that develops from immature nerve cells found in several areas of the body and it usually starts in the adrenal glands. It doesn't typically present with permeating lesions in all bones. Metastasis from osteosarcoma is a possibility, but osteosarcoma usually affects the long bones and doesn't typically permeate all bones of the body. Metastasis from Wilm's tumour, a type of kidney cancer, also doesn't typically present with permeating lesions in all bones. Histiocytosis X, also known as Langerhans cell histiocytosis, is a rare disease that involves clonal proliferation of Langerhans cells, abnormal cells deriving from bone marrow and capable of migrating from skin to lymph nodes. It can affect any organ of the body, but it most commonly affects the bone, causing lesions throughout the body.", "answer_choice": "C. Histiocytosis X"}
